description.zh-cn: 日本国会的上议院，1947年随著《日本国宪法》的施行而成立，前身为贵族院。因其具有对国家政策再检视、反应多样民意、防止立法草率等特质，有“良识之府”的称呼。
description.en: The upper house of the National Diet of Japan, established on May 20, 1947, with the enforcement of the Constitution of Japan, succeeding the House of Peers. It is known as the "House of Good Sense" for its role in re-examining national policy, reflecting diverse public opinion, and preventing hasty legislation.

description.zh-cn: 日本的最高国家权力机关与唯一立法机关，由众议院和参议院构成。
description.en: The supreme organ of state power and sole law-making organ of Japan, consisting of the House of Representatives and the House of Councillors.

description.zh-cn: 日本帝国议会的上议院，是参议院的前身。
description.en: The upper house of the Imperial Diet of Japan, the predecessor to the House of Councillors.

description.zh-cn: 日本国会的下议院。
description.en: The lower house of the National Diet of Japan.

description.zh-cn: 日本的宪法，于1946年11月3日公布，1947年5月3日施行。
description.en: The constitution of Japan, promulgated on November 3, 1946, and put into effect on May 3, 1947.

en: Constitution of the Empire of Japan

description.zh-cn: 日本帝国的第一部宪法，确立了帝国议会的地位。
description.en: The first constitution of the Empire of Japan, which established the status of the Imperial Diet.

description.zh-cn: 根据《大日本帝国宪法》设立的日本立法机关，由众议院和贵族院组成。
description.en: The legislature of the Empire of Japan, established under the Meiji Constitution, composed of the House of Representatives and the House of Peers.

description.zh-cn: 日本政治家，参议院议长。
description.en: Japanese politician, Speaker of the House of Councillors.

description.zh-cn: 日本的一个主要政党。
description.en: A major political party in Japan.

description.zh-cn: 日本政治家，参议院副议长。
description.en: Japanese politician, Vice-Speaker of the House of Councillors.

en: The Constitutional Democratic Party of Japan (2020)

description.zh-cn: 日本的一个主要在野党。
description.en: A major opposition party in Japan.

description.zh-cn: 日本法学家、政治家，在二战后宪法制定过程中主张两院制。
description.en: Japanese jurist and statesman who advocated for a bicameral system during the post-WWII constitution drafting process.

nodes.id: 联合国军最高司令官总司令部

zh-cn: 联合国军最高司令官总司令部
en: Supreme Commander for the Allied Powers

description.zh-cn: 二战后占领日本的盟军机构，在《日本国宪法》制定过程中发挥了重要作用。
description.en: The Allied occupation authority in Japan after World War II, which played a significant role in the drafting of the Constitution of Japan.

description.zh-cn: 由联合国军最高司令官总司令部提出的日本宪法修正案草案，最初提议设立一院制国会。
description.en: A draft constitutional amendment for Japan proposed by the Supreme Commander for the Allied Powers, which initially proposed a unicameral legislature.

description.zh-cn: 日本的国家象征和日本国民统合的象征，该职位依据《日本国宪法》而设立。
description.en: The symbol of the state of Japan and of the unity of the Japanese people, a position established under the Constitution of Japan.

description.zh-cn: 日本政治家，日本共产党委员长。
description.en: Japanese politician, Chairman of the Japanese Communist Party.

description.zh-cn: 日本的一个政党。
description.en: A political party in Japan.

description.zh-cn: 一项旨在将日本邮政事业民营化的法案。
description.en: A bill aimed at privatizing Japan's postal services.

nodes.id: 关于实施为应对恐怖对策的海上阻止活动的补给支援活动的特别措施法

zh-cn: 关于实施为应对恐怖对策的海上阻止活动的补给支援活动的特别措施法
补给支援特别措施法案

description.zh-cn: 一项关于海上补给支援活动的日本法律。
description.en: A Japanese law regarding maritime replenishment support activities.

description.zh-cn: 参议院是日本国会的上议院。
description.en: The House of Councillors is the upper house of the National Diet of Japan.

description.zh-cn: 众议院是日本国会的下议院。
description.en: The House of Representatives is the lower house of the National Diet of Japan.

description.zh-cn: 参议院根据1947年施行的《日本国宪法》而成立。
description.en: The House of Councillors was established under the Constitution of Japan, which came into effect in 1947.

description.zh-cn: 参议院的成立取代了其前身贵族院。
description.en: The establishment of the House of Councillors replaced its predecessor, the House of Peers.

description.zh-cn: 1889年颁布的《大日本帝国宪法》确立了帝国议会的地位。
description.en: The Constitution of the Empire of Japan, promulgated in 1889, established the status of the Imperial Diet.

description.zh-cn: 联合国军最高司令官总司令部（GHQ）提出的麦克阿瑟草案中，最初提议国会只由众议院一院组成，未包含参议院。
description.en: The MacArthur Draft proposed by the Supreme Commander for the Allied Powers (GHQ) initially suggested a unicameral diet consisting only of the House of Representatives, not including a House of Councillors.

description.zh-cn: 日本代表松本烝治在宪法制定过程中，强烈反对一院制，要求实行两院制，促成了参议院的成立。
description.en: During the constitution-making process, Japanese representative Matsumoto Jōji strongly opposed a unicameral system and demanded a bicameral system, which led to the establishment of the House of Councillors.

relationships.source: 联合国军最高司令官总司令部

description.zh-cn: 面对日本方面的反对，联合国军最高司令官总司令部（GHQ）以民选议员为前提，同意保留两院制，从而允许了参议院的成立。
description.en: Facing opposition from the Japanese side, the Supreme Commander for the Allied Powers (GHQ) agreed to maintain the bicameral system on the condition that its members be popularly elected, thus allowing the establishment of the House of Councillors.

description.zh-cn: 关口昌一出身于自由民主党，就任议长后按惯例脱离党团。
description.en: Sekiguchi Masakazu is from the Liberal Democratic Party; upon assuming the speakership, he left the party caucus as is customary.

description.zh-cn: 福山哲郎出身于立宪民主党，就任副议长后按惯例脱离党团。
description.en: Fukuyama Tetsurō is from the Constitutional Democratic Party; upon assuming the vice-speakership, he left the party caucus as is customary.

description.zh-cn: 日本天皇会在参议院全体会议大厅出席国会开幕式。
description.en: The Emperor of Japan attends the opening ceremony of the National Diet in the main hall of the House of Councillors.

description.zh-cn: 日本共产党委员长志位和夫于2016年1月4日首次出席在参议院举行的国会开幕式，改变了该党长期抵制该仪式的惯例。
description.en: On January 4, 2016, Kazuo Shii, Chairman of the Japanese Communist Party, attended the Diet opening ceremony held in the House of Councillors for the first time, changing the party's long-standing practice of boycotting the ceremony.

description.zh-cn: 参议院在全体会议上否决了众议院通过的邮政民营化关联法案，导致当日众议院解散，法案成为废案。
description.en: The House of Councillors rejected the Postal Privatization Bill passed by the House of Representatives, leading to the dissolution of the House of Representatives on the same day and the bill's demise.

relationships.target: 关于实施为应对恐怖对策的海上阻止活动的补给支援活动的特别措施法

description.zh-cn: 参议院否决了补给支援特别措施法案。
description.en: The House of Councillors rejected the Special Measures Bill on Replenishment Support Activities.

relationships.target: 关于实施为应对恐怖对策的海上阻止活动的补给支援活动的特别措施法

description.zh-cn: 在参议院否决当天，众议院利用“众议院优越”原则，以三分之二以上多数进行再表决，使法案最终成立。
description.en: On the same day the bill was rejected by the House of Councillors, the House of Representatives used its constitutional superiority to pass the bill into law with a two-thirds majority.
